Description: Bowl of Nile silt pottery with flat base and flaring sides, coated with red slip and burnished; the interior walls are decorated with white pigment in a repeating pattern of two pendant triangles filled with cross-hatching and one chevron. The interior base is untreated. There was a line of white around the lip edge. The paint has mostly faded leaving ghost impressions.
Curator's comments: Petrie’s White Cross line (C) ware. From Petrie’s excavations at Hu: see W. M. F. Petrie, Diospolis Parva: the cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. Egypt Exploration Fund Memoir 20. (London 1901).
